Package calculator_tests

Class CalculatorTest

java.lang.Object
calculator_tests.CalculatorTest
@DisplayName("Calculator test class")
public class CalculatorTest
extends java.lang.Object

CalculatorTest

This class is used for testing Calculator class and all of its methods.
Since:
2021-2-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
zoran pantos

  • Method Details

    • testCalculator

      @Test @DisplayName("Null reference test") public void testCalculator()
      Tests if calculator instance is not null.

    • testGetCurrentValue

      @Test @DisplayName("Get value test") public void testGetCurrentValue()
      Tests if starting value of a Calculator class is 0.

    • testSetCurrentValue

      @Test @DisplayName("Set value test") public void testSetCurrentValue()
      Tests the correct setting up starting value of Calculator class.

    • testExceptionsParameterized

      @DisplayName("Exceptions test") @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("methodExceptionWithParameters") public void testExceptionsParameterized​(java.lang.Exception exception, java.lang.Double value, char operation, java.lang.String message)
      Used for parameterized tests. Tests when exceptions should be thrown.
      Parameters:
      exception - will be of type DivisionByZeroException or NotSupportedOperationException
      value - value
      operation - operation for execution
      message - message for exception

    • testCalculateParameterized

      @DisplayName("Standard arithmetic operations test") @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("methodOperationsWithParameters") public void testCalculateParameterized​(java.lang.Double baseValue, java.lang.Double factor, char operation, java.lang.Double result) throws DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
      Used for parameterized tests. Tests execution of arithmetic operations.
      Parameters:
      baseValue - base value for arithmetic operation
      factor - factor
      operation - arithmetic operation
      result - result of arithmetic operation
      Throws:
      DivisionByZeroException - thrown when factor is 0 and operation is division
      NotSupportedOperationException - thrown when operation is not from { +, -, *, / }
